hero.title: Train Your Team to Spot Real Threats
hero.subtitle: Interactive simulations that teach your team to identify phishing, BEC scams, and social engineering attacks. Build the decision-making skills that protect your organization.

whyTrainingFails.title: Why Traditional Training Fails
whyTrainingFails.subtitle: Most phishing training teaches you to spot "sloppy fake emails." Real attackers win by exploiting urgent workflows — often without any suspicious links.

decisionBased.title: Decision-Based Learning
decisionBased.description: Train the right behavior: "What is the safest next action?" — not just "is this phishing?"

realistic.title: Realistic Scenarios
realistic.description: Email, SMS, and call simulations covering BEC, pretexting, spoofing, and modern attack patterns.

adaptive.title: Adaptive Difficulty
adaptive.description: NIST Phish Scale methodology ensures learners build skills progressively, not get overwhelmed.

channels.title: Multi-Channel Training
channels.subtitle: Real threats arrive via multiple channels. Train across all of them.

email.title: Email
email.description: Classic phishing, credential theft, malicious attachments, and BEC attacks

sms.title: SMS
sms.description: Smishing attacks, wrong-number scams, and urgent action requests

calls.title: Calls
calls.description: Vishing transcripts, tech support scams, and impersonation attempts

behaviors.title: Key Training Behaviors
behaviors.subtitle: Three skills that actually prevent breaches

pauseInspect.title: Pause + Inspect
pauseInspect.description: Break the "21 seconds to click" habit. Users click phishing links in seconds — training the pause reflex is critical.

classify.title: Classify the Request
classify.description: Focus on what's being asked: money, credentials, access, permissions, or downloads. The request type determines the risk.

verify.title: Verify via Known Channel
verify.description: Don't reply to suspicious emails asking "is this real?" Use a verified contact method, then report.

cta.title: Ready to Train Smarter?
cta.subtitle: Start building real security awareness skills today. No credit card required.

footer.tagline: Training real security awareness, not trivia.

dashboard.title: Dashboard
dashboard.subtitle: Track your progress and start training

incidentResponse.title: Incident Response Training
incidentResponse.subtitle: Learn what to do when something goes wrong

actions.reportDescription: Flag as suspicious and escalate to security team
actions.verifyDescription: Contact sender through a known channel to confirm
actions.proceedDescription: Take the requested action (click link, open attachment, etc.)

lensTool.title: Inspection Checklist
lensTool.subtitle: Check at least 3 items before deciding

intro.title: Incident Response Training
intro.description: You've just discovered a potential security incident. Practice the critical steps to report and recover.

detect.title: Stage 1: Detect & Document
detect.description: What did you observe? Document the incident details.

contain.title: Stage 2: Contain
contain.description: Take immediate action to limit the damage.

recover.title: Stage 4: Recover
recover.description: Take steps to restore normal operations.

complete.title: Drill Complete!
complete.feedback: You completed all critical incident response steps.
